New Records: Sese Bau became the second Papua New Guinea batter to hit a fifty in the T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Sese Bau played a fine knock of 50 runs against co-hosts West Indies.
Romario Shepherd claimed the wicket of Tony Ura in the second over.
Spinner Akeal Hosein dismissed number three batsman Lega Siaka with a well-executed arm ball.
Alzarri Joseph sent PNG skipper Assad Vala back to the pavilion.
Sese Bau's 50 off 43 balls helped stabilize PNG's innings.
Bau's 44-run partnership with Charles Amini proved crucial in averting a complete collapse.
Pre-Game Insights: WI captain Rovman Powell won the toss and chose to bowl vs Papua New Guinea.
Miscellaneous Highlights: PNG faced an uphill battle from the outset, starting their innings on a shaky note.
The West Indies bowlers, particularly their spinners, exploited the pitch conditions effectively.
